comments:
Build ID: I20061214-1445

Steps To Reproduce:
1.create a workspace using 3.3M4
2.where the target platform is eclipse 3.2.x
3.create a plugin project and another project with a junit3 test for the plugin
try run the junit plugin test. it fails to run

More information:
3.3 M4 fails to run a junit3 plugin test 
when the eclipse target platform is 3.2.x (regardless if the JRE is 1.4.2_x or 1.5_)

these are the logs

=======================================
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.version=1.4.2_13

Framework arguments:  -version 3 -port 33946 -testLoaderClass org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.junit3.JUnit3TestLoader -application org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime.legacytestapplication -product org.eclipse.sdk.ide -pdelaunch -testpluginname my.plugin.project.test -loaderpluginname org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime -classnames my.plugin.project.actions.SampleActionTest
Command-line arguments:  -version 3 -port 33946 -testLoaderClass org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.junit3.JUnit3TestLoader -application org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime.legacytestapplication -product org.eclipse.sdk.ide -data /home/ecomar/devel/ws/test-workspace/../junit-workspace -dev file:/home/ecomar/devel/ws/test-workspace/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/pde-junit/dev.properties -pdelaunch -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -testpluginname my.plugin.project.test -loaderpluginname org.eclipse.jdt.junit.runtime -classnames my.plugin.project.actions.SampleActionTest

From the logs, this looks like it will probably fail in all OS's.  I will go ahead and take a look at this one to see if we can fix it nice and quick.

Should be fixed in HEAD.  The problem came in with some work done to support the runtime application changes in 3.3.  

Modified line 221 in org.eclipse.pde.ui.launcher.JUnitLaunchConfigurationDelegate.  

Previous line:
application = TargetPlatform.usesNewApplicationModel() ? UI_APPLICATION : LEGACY_UI_APPLICATION;

New line:
application = TargetPlatform.usesNewApplicationModel() || TargetPlatform.getTargetVersion() <= 3.2 ? UI_APPLICATION : LEGACY_UI_APPLICATION;

Wassim, I copied you incase this would cause problems else where in your code.  If so, please let me know.

Brian, this won't work.

The fix on is to launch with the org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime plug-in from the "host" instance at all times from now on.
Reassigning to the person who broke it :)

can anyone explain a bit the workaround I can use to launch my junits while waiting for M5 ? 
for the rest M4 is good for me!

Grrr - just ran into this as well when doing a fix for 3.2.2. This caused me major grief because I had to setup a new workspace (didn't want to trash my existing R3_2_maintenance workspace that I normally run with 3.3 by starting it with R3.2.*).

my workaround - in the TARGET eclipse replace 
the 3.2 plugin org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime
with the one from 3.3M4 

e.g. move/delete this jar 
org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime_3.2.0.v20060605.jar
and add this one 
org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime_3.3.0.v20061211-0010.jar

of course this works for me as my plugins do not depend on that one.

Fixed.

we should launch the 'org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime.legacytestapplication' app only if:
1. the target/workspace do not use the new application model
AND
2. the org.eclipse.pde.junit.runtime plug-in we are launching with has a version that is >= 3.3
